mizerReef 1.0.1
  • Reference

    Detritus dynamics

    detritus_dynamics.Rd

    Calculates the detritus biomass at the next time step based on the current detritus biomass.

    Usage

    detritus_dynamics(params, n, n_other, rates, dt, ...)

    Arguments

    params

    A MizerParams object

    n

    A matrix of current species abundances (species x size)

    n_other

    Other dynamic components.

    rates

    A list of rates as returned by getRates()

    dt

    Time step size

    ...

    Unused

    Value

    A vector giving the detritus spectrum at the next time step.

    Details

    The time evolution of the detritus biomass \(B\) is described by

    $$dB_D/dt = P_D - c_D \cdot B_D $$

    where \(c_D\) is the mass-specific rate of consumption, calculated with detritus_consumption()and \(P_D\) is the rate at which the rest of the system produces detritus biomass, calculate with getDetritusProduction().

    The dynamical equation is solved analytically to

    $$B_D(t+dt) = B(t)\exp(-c_D \cdot dt) + \frac{P_D}{c_D} (1-\exp(-c_D \cdot dt)).$$

    This avoids the stability problems that would arise if we used the Euler method to solve the equation numerically.

    See also

    algae_dynamics(), detritus_consumption(), getDetritusConsumption(), getDetritusProduction()
